description: Flex, which began as a street dance by young people across East New York and Flatbush, Brooklyn, now has fans across the world and is the subject of a film, “Flex Is Kings.”
title: They’ve Got Moves
title_page: They’ve Got Moves - The New York Times
maintext:
Flex is the dance. Its practitioners tell stories — cinematic slices of street life — gliding, pausing, dropping, shivering, contorting. One moment their movements are smooth and airy, then suddenly they’re violent, sharp like broken glass. Dancers slow time and speed it up. They use props, costumes and illusion. And their faces twist, transmitting fear, fury, love, mockery.
Deidre Schoo, 34, who photographs frequently for The New York Times, discovered flex in 2008. Fascinated by the dancers’ displays of “brotherhood and creativity,” she began following several performers.
